teams.ucmTeam
Class TeamManager

java.lang.Object
  teams.ucmTeam.TeamManager

public abstract class TeamManager
extends java.lang.Object

The team manager is the object that controls the team. It is responsible for creating all the behaviours that the team robots could use during the match and it will change the behaviour of each robot during the match.

It also can be used to communicate strategies among robots/roles.

The lifecycle of a team manager is the following one:

  • The TeamManager is configured only once, executing the configure method. In this method it creates all the available behaviours (using the createBehaviours method) and configure them.
  • Every time a robot is created in the team, it asks the TeamManager for its default behaviour using the getDefaultBehaviour method
  • The takeStep method is invoked on each frame time. During this time, the team manager can process the pending messages and change the robot behaviours using the setBehaviour(Behaviour) method of the corresponding robot

Subclasses must implement the following methods:

  • onConfigure(): invoked by configure method
  • onTakeStep()
  • createBehaviours()
  • getDefaultBehaviour(int)

Author:
GAIA (UCM)

Method Detail

onConfigure

public abstract int onConfigure()
This method is invoked by configure method before any behaviour configuration.

Returns:
WorldAPI.ROBOT_OK or WorldAPI.ROBOT_ERROR (when the role is not correctly defined)

takeStep

public final void takeStep()
Runs the team manager every time step

getDefaultBehaviour

public abstract Behaviour getDefaultBehaviour(int id)
Returns the initial default behaviour of the player specified by the id. This method must be implemented by subclasses

Parameters:
id - The robot id
Returns:
The behaviour for the corresponding robot

id
 in the team





Parameters:
id - the player id of the robot in the team

configure

public final void configure()
Initialization of the team manager. It will create the available behaviours and it will configure them

createBehaviours

public abstract Behaviour[] createBehaviours()

Abstract method that creates an array with all the available behaviours that the team manager can use during a match.

Subclasses must implement this method, returning a non-empty array

Returns:
The array with the available behaviours

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(Message message)
Stores a message sent by a robot.

Parameters:
message - The new incoming message
